back_flavor: Louis Cunningham is a detective who stops at nothing to get results. He's a master at extracting confessions from criminals in the interrogation room, using both force and cunning. But that's not his true identity. When his official duties are over, he becomes a vigilante, quietly monitoring the social scene in Arkham. Of course, if he crosses paths with a fellow colleague on the street, he might end up back behind bars. Nevertheless, Louis will do whatever it takes to eradicate the malevolent forces that has taken hold in Arkham.

back_flavor: Anne Winters, a seasoned coroner, finds herself assigned to the eerie town of Arkham, Massachusetts. Over the course of her months there, she becomes increasingly aware that the town has witnessed a series of perplexing deaths that defy explanation, unrelated to gang conflicts or conventional crimes. On one scorching summer day, Anne's life takes an irreversible turn when she's tasked whith examining an unidentified corpse: a human body bearing a disturbingly canie-like visage. Gazing upon these inexplicable creatures, Anne's initial fear give way to an overwhelming curiosity. Could there be a purpose behind the deuge of these enigmatic bodies that plague Arkham? Driven by an insatiable need to uncover the mysteries surrounding the influx of these bizarre corpses, Anne resolves to take matters into her own hands.

back_flavor: The Zenith of the Truth claims to be the protector of humanity. One day, while working as a detective in Boston, Chad came across a grotesquely disfigured body. While investigating the scene, he was suddenly attacked by a group of masked socialites. As Chad caught his breath after the ordeal, a woman approached him. The gruesome scene seemed oddly familiar to her, and she nonchalantly introduced herself as Cynthia, a member of a secret society called the Zenith of the Truth. She proceeded to tell him an outrageous tale of how these societies were poisoning the world to summon a terrifying entity. Chad, however, felt in his gut that Cynthia was telling the truth. From that day forward, Chad became a protector of humanity.

back_flavor: In childhood, Jean was gathering herbs in the Louisiana swamps when she was bitten by a werewolf, transforming her into a monstrous amalgamation of man and beast. This bestowed upon her an unusually long life. Yet, perhaps even more heinous than the werewolf's curse was the burden of a long line of names. More than towo hundred years have passed since the Salem witch trials concluded, but Jean Scarlett still vividly recalls those dark days. She remembers the burning stakes, the gallows, and the shattered sourls of her sisters. Now, in the present day, descendants of those tyrants still walk the earth, and there are those among them who seek to bring about the end of the world. Jean's only hope lies in the world's salvation, and perhaps her own.

back_flavor: From the simple act of picking up a penny on the sidewalk when she couldn't fit in with her friends, to the tragic event of being struck by a truck, a collision that claimed her life and was orchestrated by the same gang member who had killed her parents, Olive Scott had always had a vague sense that she was born lucky. However, just as a coin has two sides, so do blessings. Olive gradually came to realize that hermisfortune could be her good fortune. Upon reaching adulthood, Olive harnessed this luck, as it seemed to be her only innate talent, and joined the Accombe branch of fading Pinkerton Detective Agency, starting as a rookie detective. Then, one night, in a vivid dream, a gray-haired old man appeared to Olive. He revealed that she was his chosen agent, tasked with confronting the evil that was running rempant in Accombe. The question lingered inher mind: Could this enigmatic old man be the source of all her good fortune? Motivated by curiosity and determination, Olive embraced the role of “proxy” to determine whether her life had been marked by luck or misfortune all along.
